isis.stitle: VT 365 Diesel Engine - 2004 Model Year - CRANKCASE, CRANKSHAFT and BEARINGS, CAMSHAFT and BUSHINGS - Cleaning, Inspection, and Testing - Crankshaft

step1.para: Clean and inspect the crankshaft and main bearings.
Clean crankshaft with a suitable solvent.

warning.para: To prevent personal injury or death, wear safety glasses with side shields to protect eyes. Limit compressed air pressure to 207 kPa (30 psi).

step1.para: Use a stiff nylon brush to clean oil passages in crankshaft. Loosen accumulated dirt, sludge, and deposits.
Flush oil passages with a suitable solvent.
Inspect crankshaft journals (main and connecting rod) for scratches, grooves, and scoring.
Inspect crankshaft main bearings for scratches, grooves, scoring, pitting, and inconsistent coloring.

figure.caption: Measurement for crankshaft connecting rod journal

step1.para: Use a 3-4 inch micrometer to measure the diameter of each journal (main and connecting rod). Measure each journal at two points 90° apart. Move micrometer over entire width of journal .

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, the crankshaft must be reground or replaced, if journals exceed maximum out-of-round or taper specifications.
